title: Introduction to Plant Propagation in Timor Leste

questions.question: Which biodiversity hotspot is Timor Leste a part of?
Approximately how many plant species have been recorded in Timor Leste?
Which of the following is NOT a major ecosystem found in Timor Leste?
What is the dominant type of agriculture in Timor Leste?
Which of the following is NOT a main subsistence crop in Timor Leste?
What is a major challenge facing agricultural systems in Timor Leste?
What is an advantage of sexual propagation in plants?
Which of the following is NOT a method of asexual propagation?
What is a disadvantage of asexual propagation?
Why is preserving native plant species important for Timor Leste?
What is a benefit of native plants being adapted to local conditions?
choices: They are more susceptible to pests
They are often more resilient to local pests and diseases
They grow faster than non-native species
questions.answer: They are often more resilient to local pests and diseases

questions.question: What is the term for the root system and lower part of the stem onto which another variety is grafted?
What is the detached living portion of a plant joined to a stock in grafting called?
Which of the following is a cash crop in Timor Leste?
What is agroforestry?
choices: A land use management system combining trees with crops or livestock
A technique for propagating forest species
questions.answer: A land use management system combining trees with crops or livestock

questions.question: Which native tree species of Timor Leste is known for its aromatic wood and has been historically overexploited?
Which Eucalyptus species is endemic to Timor and nearby islands?
What is a potential use for the Candlenut tree (Aleurites moluccana) in Timor Leste?
Which native tree species is particularly important for high-altitude reforestation in Timor Leste?
What is a potential benefit of using advanced propagation techniques for native plant species in Timor Leste?
How can plant propagation contribute to climate change adaptation in Timor Leste?
choices: By increasing the use of fossil fuels
By developing and distributing climate-resilient plant varieties
By encouraging the use of non-native species
questions.answer: By developing and distributing climate-resilient plant varieties

questions.question: What is a potential cultural benefit of preserving native plant species through propagation in Timor Leste?
choices: Preservation of plants used in traditional medicine
questions.answer: Preservation of plants used in traditional medicine

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a typical challenge in Timor Leste's agricultural sector?
What is a key advantage of vegetative propagation for native plant species in Timor Leste?
Which propagation method involves joining a scion to a rootstock?
What is micropropagation in the context of plant propagation?
choices: Use of microscopes in plant breeding

questions.question: Which of the following is a potential economic opportunity from preserving and propagating native plant species in Timor Leste?
choices: Increased importation of foreign plant species
Development of the herbal medicine market
questions.answer: Development of the herbal medicine market

questions.question: What role can improved plant propagation techniques play in addressing soil erosion in Timor Leste?
choices: Increase the use of chemical fertilizers
Support the growth of deep-rooted native plants for soil stabilization
questions.answer: Support the growth of deep-rooted native plants for soil stabilization

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a typical ecosystem service provided by native plant species in Timor Leste?
What is a potential benefit of combining grafting techniques with native plant species in Timor Leste?
choices: Improved fruit quality while maintaining local adaptations
questions.answer: Improved fruit quality while maintaining local adaptations
